channel.title: JaneBytes Cybersecurity Feed
channel.description: Summarized articles from top cybersecurity sources.

item.title: Beware: Fake AI Business Tools Spreading Hidden Ransomware
item.description:
Cybercriminals are deploying ransomware through deceptive campaigns targeting small businesses that adopt artificial intelligence (AI) tools. Attackers create fake websites and software installers that mimic popular AI services, leading to the installation of malware such as CyberLock, Lucky_Gh0$t, or Numero, which can render systems unusable or demand payment in cryptocurrency.
FYSA: Cybercriminals are capitalizing on the AI boom by targeting small businesses with ransomware attacks, posing a dual risk of immediate system compromise and long-term damage to confidence in digital tools.

item.title: New PathWiper data wiper malware hits critical infrastructure in Ukraine
item.description: PathWiper is a newly discovered data wiper malware used in targeted attacks against critical infrastructure in Ukraine, aimed at disrupting operations. The payload was deployed through a legitimate endpoint administration tool and has similar functionality to HermeticWiper, previously deployed by the 'Sandworm' threat group.

item.title: Scattered Spider Hackers Target Tech Company Help-Desk Administrators
item.description: The Scattered Spider hacking group has launched a targeted campaign against help-desk administrators at major technology companies, using advanced social engineering techniques and APT methodologies to breach corporate defenses. The attackers leverage phishing, credential stuffing, and impersonation tactics to gain unauthorized access to critical systems, often exploiting human vulnerabilities as effectively as technical ones. This campaign highlights the importance of robust employee training, multi-factor authentication protocols, and continuous monitoring to detect anomalous behavior.

item.title: New Mirai Variant Exploits TBK DVR Flaw for Remote Code Execution
item.description: Vulnerable Product: TBK DVR-4104 and DVR-4216 devices; CVE(s): CVE-2024-3721; Summary: A critical command injection vulnerability (CVE-2024-3721) in TBK DVR-4104 and DVR-4216 devices allows attackers to exploit unpatched firmware, deploy a modified Mirai variant designed for IoT device hijacking and DDoS operations, and execute ARM32 binaries.

item.title: Microsoft Unveils European Security Effort to Disrupt Cybercrime Networks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Windows NTFS; CVE(s): CVE-2025-24993; Summary: A critical heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability in the Windows NTFS allows attackers to execute arbitrary code with local user privileges by crafting malicious VHD files and mounting them. The exploit requires social engineering or misleading users into believing the file is safe, and successful exploitation can result in privilege escalation, system compromise, data exfiltration, service disruption, and lateral movement.

item.title: ViperSoftX Malware Used by Threat Actors to Steal Sensitive Information
item.description: ViperSoftX is a sophisticated PowerShell-based malware designed to infiltrate infected systems, execute remote commands, steal sensitive data, and target cryptocurrency-related information. It employs deceptive tactics, abuses Windows Task Scheduler, and communicates with C&C servers using HTTP headers.

item.title: Critical Fortinet flaws now exploited in Qilin ransomware attacks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Fortinet; CVE(s): CVE-2024-21762, CVE-2024-55591; Summary: The Qilin ransomware operation is exploiting two Fortinet vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-21762 and CVE-2024-55591) to bypass authentication on vulnerable devices and execute malicious code remotely.

item.title: Empower Users and Protect Against GenAI Data Loss
item.description: The article discusses the increasing use of generative AI tools in the enterprise setting, despite attempts to block public AI apps. Employees have found workarounds to access AI systems, which creates a "Shadow AI" blind spot for organizations.

item.title: Microsoft Helps CBI Dismantle Indian Call Centers Behind Japanese Tech Support Scam
item.description: India's Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has dismantled two illegal call centers engaged in a transnational tech support scam targeting Japanese citizens, arresting four individuals and seizing evidence. The scam involved advanced social engineering techniques and "technical subterfuge" to deceive victims into transferring funds.

item.title: U.S. Offers $10M Bounty for Information on RedLine Malware Creator
item.description: This article is not about a vulnerability. Instead, it discusses the RedLine infostealer malware and its alleged developer, Maxim Alexandrovich Rudometov, who is being sought with a $10 million reward under the Rewards for Justice program. The article details the malware's features, including configuration and C2 communication, host profiling, data exfiltration, remote execution and persistence, and anti-analysis measures.

item.title: ANY.RUN Empowers Government Agencies with Real-Time Threat Detection
item.description: Government agencies worldwide are facing an unprecedented wave of cyberattacks, with attackers employing advanced tactics to breach critical infrastructure and steal sensitive data. The most prevalent attack vector remains phishing emails, with spoofed domains and malicious attachments being used to deliver malware such as FormBook.

item.title: Critical RCE Vulnerability in AWS Amplify Studio – PoC Now Public
item.description: Vulnerable Product: @aws-amplify/codegen-ui; CVE(s): CVE-2025-4318; Summary: The AWS Amplify codegen package contained a critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability due to improper input validation in expression-binding logic. The flaw allowed attackers to inject malicious expressions into component JSON files, enabling arbitrary code execution on backend build systems.

item.title: Inside the Mind of the Adversary: Why More Security Leaders Are Selecting AEV
item.description: The article discusses Adversarial Exposure Validation (AEV), an advanced offense technology that simulates real-world attacker behaviors to identify vulnerabilities in an organization's defenses. AEV provides continuous and automated testing, allowing for more efficient prioritization and remediation of security issues. The technology is designed to mimic how attackers would exploit weaknesses, enabling organizations to build resilience against attacks and provide a stronger defense posture.

item.title: Blitz Malware: A Tale of Game Cheats and Code Repositories
item.description:
The article provides a detailed technical analysis of Blitz malware, which consists of two phases: the Blitz downloader and the Blitz bot. The malware was distributed through backdoored game cheats, and it abused Hugging Face to host C2 infrastructure. The author claims to have quit distributing the malware.
The article highlights the security risks associated with engaging in illegal software distribution, including cracked game cheats. It also provides information on how Palo Alto Networks customers can be better protected from Blitz malware through various security features and subscriptions.
In summary, this article is not discussing a vulnerability (software, hardware, or firmware), but rather providing threat intelligence and analysis of the Blitz malware.

item.title: Critical FreeRTOS-Plus-TCP Flaw Allows Code Execution or System Crash
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Amazon FreeRTOS-Plus-TCP; CVE(s): CVE-2025-5688; Summary: A critical memory corruption vulnerability exists in FreeRTOS-Plus-TCP due to the lack of adequate length checking when processing LLMNR and mDNS queries with excessively long DNS names. This can lead to system crashes or arbitrary code execution, making embedded systems a high-value target for attackers.

item.title: Chrome Extensions Flaw Exposes Sensitive API Keys, Secrets and Tokens
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Various Chrome Extensions; CVE(s): None; Summary: Numerous popular Chrome extensions contain a critical security flaw that exposes sensitive credentials such as API keys, secrets, and tokens in their source code, allowing attackers to exploit them and potentially cause data manipulation, financial losses, and privacy breaches.

item.title: Critical RCE Flaw Found in HPE Insight Remote Support Tool
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Hewlett-Packard Enterprise (HPE) Insight Remote Support; CVE(s): CVE-2025-37097, CVE-2025-37098, and CVE-2025-37099; Summary: Multiple high-impact vulnerabilities in HPE's Insight Remote Support (IRS) software allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code, traverse directories, and exfiltrate sensitive information. The flaws are due to directory traversal and XML external entity (XXE) injection in the IRS service's file upload mechanism and XML input processing during device registration. Successful exploitation can result in full remote code execution under the privileges of the IRS service.

item.title: Police arrests 20 suspects for distributing child sexual abuse content
item.description: Law enforcement authorities from over a dozen countries have arrested 20 suspects in an international operation targeting the production and distribution of child sexual abuse material. The operation, which started in late 2024, involved multiple instant messaging groups dedicated to the circulation of child sexual exploitation images. Additionally, another joint international investigation led by the State Criminal Police of Bavaria and Bavarian cybercrime prosecutors took down Kidflix, one of the largest child sexual abuse material platforms on the dark web.

item.title: New pathWiper Malware Targets Critical Infrastructure to Deploy Admin Tools
item.description: This article reports a sophisticated cyberattack targeting Ukrainian critical infrastructure, deploying a previously unknown wiper malware dubbed "PathWiper." The attack is attributed to a Russia-nexus advanced persistent threat (APT) actor and showcases the evolving threat to Ukrainian critical infrastructure amid the ongoing conflict.

item.title: New PathWiper Data Wiper Malware Disrupts Ukrainian Critical Infrastructure in 2025 Attack
item.description:
The article reports on a new data wiper malware named PathWiper that was used to target a critical infrastructure entity in Ukraine. The malware is designed to gather information about connected storage media, create threads for each drive and volume, and overwrite contents with randomized bytes. It also targets specific file systems and attempts to dismount volumes.
FYSA: A Russia-nexus advanced persistent threat (APT) actor has been identified as the perpetrator of a new data wiper malware attack on Ukraine, using legitimate endpoint administration frameworks to issue malicious commands and deploy PathWiper across connected endpoints.

item.title: BADBOX 2.0 Malware Hits Over a Million Android Devices in Global Cyber Threat
item.description: The article discusses a massive cyber fraud operation named BADBOX 2.0, which has infected over 1 million Android Open Source Project (AOSP) devices worldwide. The operation is attributed to four key threat actor groups working together through shared C2 infrastructure, and involves fraudulent activities such as ad fraud, click fraud, and the sale of residential proxy services.

item.title: Paste.ee Turned Cyber Weapon: XWorm and AsyncRAT Delivered by Malicious Actors
item.description: The article discusses a new trend in phishing and malware delivery where attackers use the text-sharing website Paste.ee to host malicious payloads and scripts, often disguised as innocuous text snippets. This tactic allows threat actors to bypass traditional security defenses by exploiting the platform's accessibility and anonymity features.

item.title: PoC Exploit Released for Apache Tomcat DoS Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Apache Tomcat; CVE(s): CVE-2025-31650; Summary: A critical memory leak vulnerability in Apache Tomcat's HTTP/2 implementation allows unauthenticated denial-of-service attacks through malformed priority headers. The flaw affects Tomcat versions 9.0.76–9.0.102, 10.1.10–10.1.39, and 11.0.0-M2–11.0.5, and public exploits are already circulating.

item.title: Hackers Exploit Roundcube Vulnerability to Steal User Credentials via XSS Attack
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Roundcube; CVE(s): CVE-2024-42009, None; Summary: The Roundcube webmail platform has a critical Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability (CVE-2024-42009) that allows attackers to execute arbitrary JavaScript code, enabling credential theft and potential server takeover.

item.title: Google’s upcoming Gemini Kingfall is allegedly a coding beast
item.description: Vulnerable Product: None; FYSA: The article discusses the advancements in Google's AI models, specifically the "Gemini Kingfall" model that was briefly available before being taken down. It highlights the capabilities of Gemini Kingfall, such as generating a working single HTML file Minecraft game clone using a three-line prompt.

item.title: ChatGPT prepares o3-pro model for $200 Pro subscribers
item.description: Vulnerable Product: None; Summary: The article does not mention any vulnerabilities. It discusses updates to ChatGPT models, including the new o3 Pro model, and their capabilities.

item.title: Proxy Services Feast on Ukraine’s IP Address Exodus
item.description:
The article discusses how Ukraine's Internet Protocol Version 4 (IPv4) address space has been affected by the Russian invasion. Many Ukrainian ISPs have sold or leased their IPv4 address blocks to proxy and anonymity services, which are now being used to route traffic from multiple countries, including those with a high incidence of cybercrime activity. This has resulted in many former Ukrainian IP addresses being used in cyberattacks against Ukraine and other enemies of Russia.
FYSA: The article highlights the vulnerability of Ukraine's Internet infrastructure to Russian control or manipulation, as well as the potential for proxy services to be abused for malicious purposes.

item.title: FBI: BADBOX 2.0 Android malware infects millions of consumer devices
item.description: Vulnerable Product: BADBOX 2.0; CVE(s): None; Summary: The BADBOX 2.0 malware campaign has infected over 1 million home Internet-connected devices, converting consumer electronics into residential proxies used for malicious activity, such as ad fraud and credential stuffing. The malware infects devices preloaded with the botnet or through malicious Android applications that sneak onto Google Play and third-party app stores.

item.title: Iranian APT ‘BladedFeline’ Remains Hidden in Networks for 8 Years
item.description: The article discusses the activities of BladedFeline, an Iranian-aligned Advanced Persistent Threat (APT) group that has maintained covert access to the networks of Kurdish and Iraqi government officials for nearly eight years. The group uses various tools and techniques, including backdoors, reverse shells, and custom tunneling tools, to exploit vulnerabilities and exfiltrate data.

item.title: ZDI-25-325: Hewlett Packard Enterprise Insight Remote Support processAttachmentDataStream Directory Traversal Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Hewlett Packard Enterprise Insight Remote Support; CVE(s): CVE-2025-37099; Summary: The vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations without authentication. The issue occurs due to the lack of proper validation of a user-supplied path prior to using it in file operations, enabling an attacker to execute code in the context of SYSTEM.

item.title: New Chaos RAT Targets Linux and Windows Users to Steal Sensitive Data
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Chaos RAT; CVE(s): CVE-2024-30850, CVE-2024-31839; Summary: Chaos RAT is a remote administration tool that allows attackers to deploy payloads across diverse systems. The latest variants target both Linux and Windows environments with sophisticated capabilities for espionage and data exfiltration. A critical vulnerability in its web panel (CVE-2024-30850) allows remote code execution on the server itself, while an XSS issue (CVE-2024-31839) underscores its dual-edged nature as a tool for attackers and a potential target for counter-exploitation.

item.title: ViperSoftX Malware Enhances Modularity, Stealth, and Persistence Techniques
item.description: The article discusses a new variant of the ViperSoftX stealer malware that uses PowerShell and showcases advancements in modularity, stealth, and persistence mechanisms. It targets cryptocurrency users and enterprises, and its features include enhanced operational security, dynamic adaptability, and persistence mechanisms.

item.title: China Accuses Taiwan of Operating APT Groups with US Support
item.description:
Vulnerable Product: None; Summary: The article reports on Chinese allegations of Taiwan-based Advanced Persistent Threat (APT) groups conducting long-term cyber espionage and sabotage against critical infrastructure, government bodies, and key industries in China, Hong Kong, and Macao. These groups are accused of stealing sensitive intelligence, collaborating with the US government, and using tactics such as phishing campaigns, exploiting known vulnerabilities, and deploying open-source tools for initial access and persistence.
FYSA: The article discusses the alleged activities of Taiwan-based APT groups, referred to as "T-APTs," which are claimed to be supported by Taiwan's Information, Communications and Electronic Force Command (ICEFCOM) and have close ties with the United States. These groups are accused of conducting cyber warfare, public opinion manipulation, and cognitive warfare against China, acting as proxies for a so-called "color revolution."

item.title: Everyone's on the cyber target list
item.description:
This article is not about a vulnerability, but it contains cybersecurity-relevant content. The summary should focus on threat actors, tactics, infrastructure, scams, or impacts.
FYSA: The article discusses the importance of cybersecurity awareness and the need for basic cyber hygiene. It highlights the fact that anyone can be a victim of a cyber attack and emphasizes the importance of ensuring endpoint security, monitoring for unusual administrative activity, and staying informed on evolving threats to mitigate potential risks. Additionally, the article mentions various cybersecurity-related events and conferences.

item.title: Beware of Fake Zoom Client Downloads Granting Attackers Access to Your Computer
item.description: This article describes a phishing campaign that exploits the popularity of Zoom by tricking users into downloading malicious software under the guise of a legitimate update. The attack begins with a fake Zoom meeting invitation and ultimately installs a malware payload that grants attackers unrestricted access to the compromised system, allowing for data theft, ransomware deployment, or further network infiltration.

item.title: Old AT&T data leak repackaged to link SSNs, DOBs to 49M phone numbers
item.description: A threat actor has re-released data from a 2021 AT&T breach affecting 70 million customers, combining previously separate files to directly link Social Security numbers and birth dates to individual users. The leaked data is actually from the same 2021 breach that exposed 73 million customers' information, not a new leak.

item.title: WordPress Admins Cautioned About Fake Cache Plugin Stealing Admin Credentials
item.description: Vulnerable Product: WordPress; CVE(s): None; Summary: A malicious plugin dubbed "wp-runtime-cache" targets WordPress sites to steal admin credentials. The plugin hides in the wp-content/plugins directory and activates during site login events, capturing user input and exfiltrating sensitive data to a remote server. It specifically targets high-privilege users and employs code obfuscation techniques to remain undetected.

item.title: Hacker selling critical Roundcube webmail exploit as tech info disclosed
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Roundcube; CVE(s): CVE-2025-49113, CVE-2025-48745 (rejected as duplicate candidate); Summary: A critical remote code execution vulnerability (CVE-2025-49113) exists in Roundcube open-source webmail application versions 1.1.0 through 1.6.10. The vulnerability allows attackers to execute malicious code after authentication, and an exploit is already available for sale on underground forums.

item.title: Popular Chrome Extensions Leak API Keys, User Data via HTTP and Hardcoded Credentials
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Multiple Google Chrome extensions; CVE(s): None; Summary: Several popular Google Chrome extensions have been found to transmit sensitive data in HTTP, exposing users to privacy and security risks. The extensions hard-code secrets in their code, making them susceptible to adversary-in-the-middle (AitM) attacks, allowing malicious actors on the same network to intercept and modify the transmitted data.

item.title: How to build a robust Windows service to block malware and ransomware
item.description: This article discusses designing a security-focused Windows Service with principles such as minimal attack surface, real-time monitoring and response, robustness and resilience, scalability and performance. It also explores the components involved in building a robust security service, including monitoring engine, analysis and detection module, response and mitigation unit, logging and reporting, and communication interface.

item.title: Designing a Windows Service for Security
item.description: The article discusses the importance of designing a robust Windows Service with minimal attack surface, real-time monitoring, and response capabilities. It highlights five key design principles for developing an effective Windows Service: minimizing attack surface, real-time monitoring and response, robustness and resilience, scalability and performance, and logging and reporting.

item.title: Researchers Detail Bitter APT’s Evolving Tactics as Its Geographic Scope Expands
item.description: The article discusses the threat actor Bitter, also known as APT-C-08, APT-Q-37, Hazy Tiger, Orange Yali, T-APT-17, and TA397. It is a state-backed hacking group that targets governments, diplomatic entities, and defense organizations to gather intelligence aligned with the interests of the Indian government. The group uses spear-phishing emails and masquerades as government and diplomatic entities from various countries to entice recipients into malware-laced attachments.

item.title: Odoo Employee Database Allegedly Exposed and Put Up for Sale on Dark Web
item.description: A data breach at Odoo, a Belgian provider of open-source business management software, has reportedly occurred. The breach allegedly involves a compromised employee database, with the seller demanding $25,000 in cryptocurrency for its release. The incident highlights the persistent threat posed by insiders in enterprise environments, emphasizing the importance of robust access controls and vigilant monitoring of privileged accounts.

item.title: Members of ViLE Hacker Group Arrested for Hacking DEA Portal
item.description: Two members of the ViLE cybercriminal group were sentenced for a high-profile hacking and extortion scheme targeting a U.S. federal law enforcement web portal. The group specialized in "doxing" and used stolen credentials, impersonation, and social engineering tactics to obtain sensitive personal data and extort victims.

item.title: Critical Dell PowerScale Vulnerability Allows Attackers Unauthorized Access to Filesystem
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Dell Technologies PowerScale OneFS; CVE(s): CVE-2024-53298, CVE-2025-32753; Summary: A critical vulnerability (CVE-2024-53298) allows unauthenticated remote attackers to gain unauthorized access to the file system, potentially enabling them to read, modify, or delete arbitrary files. Another vulnerability (CVE-2025-32753) is an SQL injection issue that can be triggered by sending specially crafted requests to the affected application, allowing a low-privileged local attacker to execute arbitrary SQL queries.

item.title: TA397 Hackers Exploits Scheduled Tasks to Deploy Malware on Targeted Systems
item.description: A suspected state-backed threat actor, TA397 (also known as Bitter), has been identified by Proofpoint Threat Research. The group is believed to be aligned with Indian intelligence interests and targets entities in Europe and Asia, particularly those connected to China, Pakistan, and the Indian subcontinent. Their tactics include spearphishing, scheduled tasks for malware deployment, and manual payload delivery, showcasing adaptability and consistency in evading detection.

item.title: CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Google Chromium V8; CVE(s): CVE-2025-5419; Summary: This out-of-bounds read and write vulnerability in Google Chromium V8 poses significant risks to the federal enterprise, as it is a frequent attack vector for malicious cyber actors. The vulnerability has been added to CISA's Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog due to evidence of active exploitation.

item.title: CISA Releases Seven Industrial Control Systems Advisories
item.description: This article does not describe a specific vulnerability, but rather announces the release of seven Industrial Control Systems (ICS) advisories by CISA. These advisories provide information about current security issues and vulnerabilities in various ICS products from Hitachi Energy and Mitsubishi Electric.

item.title: Hitachi Energy Relion 670, 650 Series and SAM600-IO Product
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Hitachi Energy Relion 670, Relion 650, SAM600-IO; CVE(s): CVE-2020-28895, CVE-2020-35198; Summary: Integer Overflow or Wraparound vulnerabilities in the memory allocator of Wind River VxWorks allow an attacker to cause memory corruption on affected products.

item.title: CyberData 011209 SIP Emergency Intercom
item.description: Vulnerable Product: CyberData Equipment 011209 SIP Emergency Intercom; CVE(s): CVE-2025-30184, CVE-2025-26468, CVE-2025-30507, CVE-2025-30183, CVE-2025-30515; Summary: The 011209 SIP Emergency Intercom has multiple vulnerabilities, including authentication bypass, SQL injection, insufficiently protected credentials, and path traversal. Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities could allow an attacker to disclose sensitive information, cause a denial-of-service condition, or achieve code execution.

item.title: VMware NSX XSS Vulnerability Exposes Systems to Malicious Code Injection
item.description: Vulnerable Product: VMware NSX; CVE(s): CVE-2025-22243, CVE-2025-22244, and CVE-2025-22245; Summary: Three stored Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities were discovered in VMware NSX, affecting the NSX Manager UI, gateway firewall, and router port components. Authenticated attackers can inject malicious scripts that execute when affected interfaces are viewed by other users, exposing organizations to potential code injection attacks if left unpatched.

item.title: Hackers Exploit New HTML Trick to Deceive Outlook Users into Clicking Malicious Links
item.description: Cybercriminals have employed a sophisticated phishing email campaign targeting Czech bank customers, using HTML conditional statements to exploit differences in email client rendering and bypass security measures. The tactic displays different links based on the email client or browser used, potentially tricking users into clicking malicious links. This approach highlights the attackers' understanding of user behavior and corporate security landscapes, emphasizing the importance of staying vigilant against evolving cyber threats.

item.title: Wireshark Vulnerability Allows Attackers to Launch DoS Attacks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Wireshark; CVE(s): CVE-2025-5601; Summary: The vulnerability allows attackers to cause a denial of service (DoS) by injecting malformed packets onto a network or by convincing a user to open a specially crafted capture file. The flaw stems from a bug in the column utility module used by Wireshark's dissectors, which can be triggered during live packet capture or when analyzing saved packet trace files.

item.title: 830 Organizations Hacked via Glitch-hosted Phishing Attack Uses Telegram & Fake CAPTCHAs
item.description: Netskope Threat Labs reported a significant increase in traffic to phishing pages hosted on the Glitch platform, targeting over 830 organizations and 3,000 users. The campaigns use sophisticated techniques, including Telegram's BotAPI for exfiltrating stolen data and custom-built fake CAPTCHAs to evade security tools.

item.title: Germany fines Vodafone $51 million for privacy, security breaches
item.description:
The article reports that Vodafone GmbH, a German subsidiary of the telecommunications company Vodafone, was fined €45 million for privacy and security violations. The fines were imposed due to malicious employees in partner agencies who brokered contracts with customers on behalf of Vodafone, resulting in fraud cases. Additionally, the company's MeinVodafone and hotline authentication vulnerabilities allowed attackers to access customer eSIM profiles.
FYSA: None

item.title: Redefining Cyber Value: Why Business Impact Should Lead the Security Conversation
item.description: The article discusses the importance of a Business Value Assessment (BVA) for organizations to better understand their cybersecurity posture and financial exposure. It highlights the disconnect between security metrics and business outcomes, and how a BVA can bridge this gap by linking exposures to cost, prioritization to return, and prevention to tangible value.

item.title: Researcher Found 6 Critical Vulnerabilities in NetMRI Allow Attackers Gain Complete Admin Access
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Infoblox NetMRI; CVE(s): CVE-2025-32813, CVE-2025-32814, CVE-2025-32815, CVE-2024-54188, CVE-2024-52874; Summary: Six critical vulnerabilities have been identified in Infoblox's NetMRI version 7.5.4.104695, including unauthenticated command injection, hardcoded credentials, arbitrary file read, and SQL injection flaws that can lead to complete administrative access and compromise of entire network infrastructures if exploited.

item.title: Iran-Linked BladedFeline Hits Iraqi and Kurdish Targets with Whisper and Spearal Malware
item.description: None (This article is not about a vulnerability, but rather an Iran-aligned hacking group's cyber attacks targeting Kurdish and Iraqi government officials.)

item.title: UNC6040 APT Hackers Steals Salesforce data Without Exploit Any Vulnerabilities
item.description: UNC6040 threat cluster uses voice phishing (vishing) campaigns to compromise Salesforce environments by manipulating human behavior and impersonating IT support personnel, leading to large-scale data theft and extortion attempts. The campaign relies on tricking victims into authorizing a malicious connected app, often using modified versions of Salesforce's Data Loader tool, and leveraging infrastructure like Mullvad VPN IPs and Okta phishing panels for lateral movement.

item.title: Cisco IMC Vulnerability Allows Attackers to Gain Elevated Privileges
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Cisco Integrated Management Controller (IMC) software; CVE(s): CVE-2025-20261; Summary: A critical privilege escalation vulnerability in the IMC software allows an authenticated, remote attacker to gain elevated privileges and unauthorized access to internal services via SSH, potentially leading to full system compromise.

item.title: DoJ Seizes 145 Domains Tied to BidenCash Carding Marketplace in Global Takedown
item.description: The U.S. Department of Justice (DoJ) seized cryptocurrency funds and domains associated with the illicit carding marketplace BidenCash, which allegedly supported over 117,000 customers, trafficked over 15 million payment card numbers, and generated $17 million in revenue. The platform specialized in selling compromised credentials and offered SSH services to buyers.

item.title: Newly identified wiper malware “PathWiper” targets critical infrastructure in Ukraine
item.description: The article describes a destructive attack on Ukrainian critical infrastructure, attributed to a Russia-nexus advanced persistent threat (APT) actor. The attack used a previously unknown wiper malware called "PathWiper" that was deployed via a legitimate endpoint administration framework. PathWiper overwrites file system artifacts and destroys files by writing random bytes to disk.

item.title: ViLE gang members sentenced for extortion, police portal breach
item.description: Two members of the cybercriminal group ViLE were sentenced for hacking into a federal law enforcement web portal and using obtained personal information to harass, threaten, or extort victims. The group used methods such as impersonation, fraudulent legal requests, bribing corporate insiders, and searching public and private online databases to collect sensitive information.

item.title: CISA Releases TTPs & IoCs for Play Ransomware That Hacked 900+ Orgs
item.description: The Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA), FBI, and Australian Signals Directorate's Australian Cyber Security Centre (ASD’s ACSC) have released detailed Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures (TTPs) and Indicators of Compromise (IoCs) for the Play ransomware group. The report highlights the group's tactics, including exploiting vulnerabilities in public-facing applications, abusing valid accounts, and using tools like AdFind and Grixba to gain domain administrator access.

item.title: Critical Cisco Nexus Dashboard Vulnerability Lets Attackers Impersonate Managed Devices
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller (NDFC); CVE(s): CVE-2025-20163; Summary: The NDFC suffers from a critical SSH host key validation vulnerability, allowing unauthenticated remote attackers to impersonate managed devices. This enables MitM attacks on SSH connections, posing significant risks to data center infrastructure and potentially compromising user credentials.

item.title: Cisco Alerts Users to Critical ISE Vulnerability Exposing Sensitive Data
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Cisco Identity Services Engine (ISE); CVE(s): CVE-2025-20286; Summary: The ISE vulnerability occurs when deployed on AWS, Azure, or OCI, allowing attackers to access other ISE instances with the same software release and platform using extracted credentials. This can lead to unauthorized access, data exposure, configuration changes, and service disruptions.

item.title: U.S. Authorities Shut Down Major Dark Web Marketplace with 117,000 Users
item.description: Vulnerable Product: BidenCash; CVE(s): None; Summary: The BidenCash marketplace, operational since March 2022, was seized by law enforcement authorities, resulting in the confiscation of cryptocurrency funds and disruption of illicit transactions. The platform specialized in carding (trafficking stolen credit card data) and sold compromised credentials, including SSH access, generating upwards of $17 million in revenue.

item.title: Interlock ransomware claims Kettering Health breach, leaks stolen data
item.description: The Interlock ransomware gang has claimed responsibility for a cyberattack on the Kettering Health healthcare network, leaking data allegedly stolen from breached systems. The incident affected over 15,000 employees and led to system outages and cancellations of elective procedures.

item.title: Outlook Users Targeted by New HTML-Based Phishing Scheme
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Outlook; CVE(s): None; Summary: The article describes a sophisticated phishing technique that exploits Microsoft Outlook's handling of HTML emails to conceal malicious links from corporate users. The technique uses conditional HTML comments to display different content depending on the email client used, allowing attackers to show a legitimate URL in Outlook while redirecting others to a credential-harvesting site.

item.title: US offers $10M for tips on state hackers tied to RedLine malware
item.description: The U.S. Department of State has announced a reward of up to $10 million for information on government-sponsored hackers with ties to the RedLine infostealer malware operation and its suspected creator, Russian national Maxim Alexandrovich Rudometov. This bounty covers leads on state hackers' use of this malware in cyber operations targeting critical infrastructure organizations in the United States.

item.title: Critical Cisco ISE Auth Bypass Flaw Impacts Cloud Deployments on AWS, Azure, and OCI
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Cisco Identity Services Engine (ISE); CVE(s): CVE-2025-20286; Summary: A critical security flaw in Cisco ISE allows unauthenticated actors to access sensitive data, execute limited administrative operations, or disrupt services. The vulnerability stems from improper generation of static credentials when deploying Cisco ISE on cloud platforms, causing different deployments to share the same credentials.

item.title: Microsoft unveils free EU cybersecurity program for governments
item.description:
FYSA:
The article announces Microsoft's new European Security Program, which aims to enhance cybersecurity for European governments by leveraging artificial intelligence, strengthening partnerships, and providing real-time threat insights. The program targets nation-state actors from Russia, Iran, China, and North Korea, who are believed to be engaged in espionage activities against the EU.

item.title: FBI: Play ransomware breached 900 victims, including critical orgs
item.description: The FBI reported that the Play ransomware gang has breached approximately 900 organizations as of May 2025, using recompiled malware to evade detection. The gang also uses social engineering tactics, including phone calls, to pressure victims into paying ransoms. Additionally, initial access brokers have exploited vulnerabilities in remote monitoring and management tools to target US organizations.

item.title: Hacker arrested for breaching 5,000 hosting accounts to mine crypto
item.description: A 35-year-old hacker was arrested by Ukrainian police for breaching over 5,000 accounts at an international hosting company and using them to mine cryptocurrency, resulting in $4.5 million in damages. The hacker used open-source intelligence to find and breach vulnerable infrastructure since 2018 and had multiple accounts on hacker forums.

item.title: Cisco warns of ISE and CCP flaws with public exploit code
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Cisco Identity Services Engine (ISE) and Customer Collaboration Platform (CCP); CVE(s): CVE-2025-20286, CVE-2025-20130, CVE-2025-20129; Summary: The vulnerabilities allow unauthenticated attackers to access sensitive data, execute limited administrative operations, or disrupt services. The most severe vulnerability, CVE-2025-20286, is a critical static credential vulnerability that can be exploited by extracting user credentials from cloud deployments and using them to access installations in other cloud environments.

item.title: Ukraine claims it hacked Tupolev, Russia’s strategic warplane maker
item.description: The article describes a cyber espionage operation conducted by the Ukrainian Main Intelligence Directorate (GUR) against Russian aerospace and defense company Tupolev, which resulted in the theft of classified information, including personal data and internal communications.

item.title: Exploiting Clickfix: AMOS macOS Stealer Evades Security to Deploy Malicious Code
item.description: This article describes a campaign using an Atomic macOS Stealer (AMOS) variant, which delivers tailored payloads based on the victim's operating system. The attack involves typo-squatted domains, Clickfix method, and employs native macOS utilities to execute a devastating attack chain, stealing credentials and bypassing security mechanisms.

item.title: BidenCash carding market domains seized in international operation
item.description: Law enforcement seized multiple domains of the BidenCash dark web market for stolen credit cards, personal information, and SSH access. The operation was led by the United States Secret Service (USSS) and the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI), with support from other agencies and organizations.

item.title: Threat Actors Exploit Malware Loaders to Circumvent Android 13+ Accessibility Safeguards
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Android; CVE(s): None; Summary: Threat actors have successfully bypassed Google's accessibility restrictions in Android 13 and later versions using sophisticated malware loaders like TiramisuDropper and Brokewell. These loaders enable attackers to deploy malicious payloads, exploit accessibility features, and harvest sensitive data.

item.title: FBI warns of NFT airdrop scams targeting Hedera Hashgraph wallets
item.description: The FBI is warning about a new scam where cybercriminals exploit NFT airdrops on the Hedera Hashgraph network to steal cryptocurrency from wallets. Scammers send unsolicited NFTs or tokens with memos prompting users to click on a URL, which leads to phishing sites or dApps that ask for sensitive information.

item.title: SCATTERED SPIDER Hackers Target IT Support Teams & Bypass Multi-Factor Authentication
item.description: SCATTERED SPIDER is a cybercriminal group that has emerged as a formidable threat, targeting various sectors with advanced social engineering and technical expertise. They blend in by manipulating IT support teams, bypassing MFA through voice phishing, and using psychological tactics. Their partnership with DragonForce, a Ransomware-as-a-Service platform, amplifies their destructive potential.

item.title: DCRat Targets Latin American Users to Steal Banking Credentials
item.description: A financially motivated threat group, likely from South America, has been using a series of targeted email campaigns to deliver the DCRat banking trojan. The attacks aim to steal sensitive banking credentials and other personal information, with phishing emails containing PDF attachments or Google Docs links being used to evade detection.

item.title: New Eleven11bot Hacks 86,000 IP Cameras for Large-Scale DDoS Attack
item.description: The Eleven11bot malware has compromised over 86,000 IP cameras in the Asia-Pacific region, transforming them into a massive botnet for launching large-scale Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) attacks.

item.title: Google Exposes Vishing Group UNC6040 Targeting Salesforce with Fake Data Loader App
item.description: A financially motivated threat cluster, UNC6040, has been tracked by Google's Threat Intelligence Group (GTIG) for its voice phishing campaigns targeting Salesforce instances. The group uses social engineering tactics to impersonate IT support personnel and trick employees into granting access or sharing credentials, leading to large-scale data theft and subsequent extortion attempts.

item.title: Lumma Infostealer Developers Persist in Their Malicious Activities
item.description: This article is not about a vulnerability but discusses a coordinated law enforcement operation to target and disrupt Lumma infostealer, a malware distributed via a malware-as-a-service (MaaS) model. The operation involved seizing domains associated with Lumma's command and control (C2) servers and management dashboards, as well as using psychological tactics such as posting messages on Telegram channels.

item.title: ConnectWise ScreenConnect Breach and CVE-2025-3935: What You Need to Know
item.description: Vulnerable Product: ConnectWise ScreenConnect; CVE(s): CVE-2025-3935; Summary: A high-severity ViewState code injection vulnerability (CVE-2025-3935, CVSS 7.2) exists in ASP.NET Web Forms used by ScreenConnect, allowing attackers to steal machine keys and execute arbitrary code on the server. The vulnerability was patched in ScreenConnect version 25.2.4 released on April 24, 2025.

item.title: Media giant Lee Enterprises says data breach affects 39,000 people
item.description: Lee Enterprises, a publishing giant, has notified over 39,000 individuals whose personal information was stolen in a February 2025 ransomware attack. The attackers, believed to be the Qilin ransomware gang, stole documents containing personally identifiable information, including Social Security numbers and government ID scans.

item.title: Malicious ‘Sleeper Agent’ Browser Extensions Infected 1.5 Million Users Globally
item.description: Vulnerable Product: LayerX; CVE(s): None; Summary: A malicious network of browser extensions, dubbed "sleeper agents," has been discovered, installed on nearly 1.5 million devices worldwide. These extensions can execute remote commands, open background tabs, communicate with known malicious domains, and use encryption and base64 code obfuscation to hide their activity from traditional security tools.

item.title: Aembit Recognized on the 2025 Rising in Cyber List of Top Cybersecurity Startups
item.description: Aembit, a workload identity and access management (IAM) company, has been included in the "Rising in Cyber 2025" list, recognizing the most promising cybersecurity startups. The selection was based on real-world validation through nominations from leading cybersecurity venture firms and votes from nearly 150 chief information security officers (CISOs) and senior security executives.

item.title: Google: Hackers target Salesforce accounts in data extortion attacks
item.description: ShinyHunters extortion group is conducting social engineering attacks against multi-national companies to steal data from organizations' Salesforce platforms. The attackers impersonate IT support personnel and trick employees into connecting a modified version of Salesforce's Data Loader application, allowing them to export data stored in Salesforce instances and move laterally through connected platforms such as Okta, Microsoft 365, and Workplace.

item.title: Kerberos AS-REP roasting attacks: What you need to know
item.description: AS-REP Roasting is a threat that targets user objects in Active Directory that don't require Kerberos pre-authentication. The attack involves sending an Authentication Server Request (AS-REQ) to the Domain Controller, which responds with an Authentication Server Response (AS-REP) containing a Ticket Granting Ticket (TGT). Malicious actors can then use tools like Rubeus or Impacket to access and exploit user objects without authentication.

item.title: Top Stealer Log Telegram Channels
item.description: This article discusses the misuse of Telegram by cybercriminals involved in the collection and trade of infostealer logs. The platform is exploited through automated bots and groups for sharing or selling stolen datasets.

item.title: Chaos RAT Malware Targets Windows and Linux via Fake Network Tool Downloads
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Chaos RAT; CVE(s): CVE-2024-30850, CVSS score: 8.8 (command injection vulnerability), CVE-2024-31839, CVSS score: 4.8 (cross-site scripting flaw); Summary: A new variant of the remote access trojan (RAT) called Chaos RAT has been used in attacks targeting Windows and Linux systems. The malware's admin panel is susceptible to a command injection vulnerability that can be combined with a cross-site scripting flaw to execute arbitrary code on the server with elevated privileges.

item.title: Windows Authentication Coercion Attacks Present Major Risks to Enterprise Networks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Windows; CVE(s): None; Summary: Authentication coercion remains a potent attack vector in Windows environments, enabling attackers with low-privileged domain accounts to force targeted systems to authenticate to attacker-controlled hosts. This technique exploits NTLM and Kerberos relay attacks, potentially granting administrative access or enabling lateral movement across the network.

item.title: Your SaaS Data Isn't Safe: Why Traditional DLP Solutions Fail in the Browser Era
item.description: The article highlights the shortcomings of traditional data leakage prevention (DLP) tools in modern businesses that heavily rely on Software as a Service (SaaS) applications. It discusses how current DLP methods struggle to secure SaaS-driven workflows due to the shift from traditional file-based data handling to browser-based interactions, resulting in significant vulnerabilities and data leaks.

item.title: Updated Guidance on Play Ransomware
item.description: The Play ransomware group, also known as Playcrypt, has been highly active since June 2022, targeting various businesses and critical infrastructure across North America, South America, and Europe. The FBI has identified approximately 900 entities allegedly exploited by these actors as of May 2025.

item.title: 35,000 Internet-Connected Solar Power Systems Vulnerable to Cyberattacks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Multiple solar power devices from 42 vendors; CVE(s): CVE-2022-29303; Summary: Solar power devices, including inverters and gateways, are exposed on the internet with vulnerable management interfaces, posing a critical cybersecurity risk to global power grids. These devices can be exploited by attackers for botnet integration or as entry points into sensitive networks, potentially destabilizing power grids.

item.title: 2 certificate authorities booted from the good graces of Chrome
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Chunghwa Telecom and Netlock; CVE(s): None; Summary: Chrome will stop trusting all certificates issued by Chunghwa Telecom and Netlock after July 31, due to certificate distrust events caused by the misissuance of certificates and failure to provide updates. Certificates issued after that date will display an error page on Chrome.

item.title: APT37 Hackers Fake Academic Forum Invites to Deliver Malicious LNK Files via Dropbox Platform
item.description: APT37, a North Korean state-sponsored hacking group, launched a sophisticated spear phishing campaign targeting activists focused on North Korean issues. The campaign used Dropbox to deliver malicious shortcut (LNK) files and exploit legitimate services for nefarious purposes, showcasing APT37's evolving tactics in exploiting platforms like pCloud and Yandex for command and control (C2) operations.

item.title: New Malware Attack Uses Malicious Chrome & Edge Extensions to Steal Sensitive Data
item.description: The article discusses a sophisticated malicious campaign dubbed "Phantom Enigma" that uses dual-attack strategy involving malicious browser extensions and Remote Access Tools (RATs) to target sensitive authentication data, particularly from Banco do Brasil users. The campaign employs phishing emails, PowerShell scripts, and BAT files to install extensions that intercept user credentials during login attempts and RATs that enable broader infrastructure compromise.

item.title: IBM QRadar Vulnerabilities Expose Sensitive Configuration Files to Attackers
item.description: Vulnerable Product: IBM QRadar Suite Software and Cloud Pak for Security; CVE(s): CVE-2025-25022, CVE-2025-25021, CVE-2025-25019, CVE-2025-1334, CVE-2025-25020; Summary: The vulnerabilities in IBM's QRadar Suite Software and Cloud Pak for Security platforms allow attackers to compromise sensitive data, execute arbitrary code, or disrupt service operations. They include flaws such as password storage, code injection, session hijacking, and denial of service, with a range of severity from medium to critical.

item.title: Wireshark Certified Analyst – Wireshark Released Official Certification for Security Professionals
item.description: The Wireshark Foundation has launched the Wireshark Certified Analyst (WCA-101) certification to validate advanced proficiency in network protocol analysis and troubleshooting using Wireshark. The certification is designed for IT professionals and network engineers, aiming to recognize analytical expertise and mastery of technical terms and concepts.

item.title: Malicious PyPI, npm, and Ruby Packages Exposed in Ongoing Open-Source Supply Chain Attacks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Various packages on npm, Python, and Ruby package repositories; CVE(s): None; Summary: Several malicious packages have been found across various open-source ecosystems, including npm, Python, and Ruby. The packages drain funds from cryptocurrency wallets, erase entire codebases after installation, and exfiltrate Telegram API tokens.

item.title: Hacker targets other hackers and gamers with backdoored GitHub code
item.description: Vulnerable Product: ischhfd83 (GitHub repositories); CVE(s): None; Summary: A hacker has created a campaign on GitHub that hosts exploits, bots, and game cheats in source code containing hidden backdoors to grant remote access to infected devices. The backdoors are designed to download and install malware on devices attempting to compile the code, with obfuscated payloads and automated commits to maintain a false appearance of legitimacy.

item.title: New Crocodilus Malware Grants Full Control Over Android Devices
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Android; CVE(s): None; Summary: The Crocodilus Android banking Trojan has been identified as a sophisticated malware that can take control of devices, manipulate contact lists, and steal cryptocurrency wallet data. It uses advanced obfuscation techniques to evade detection and can be distributed through malicious ads on social platforms, bypassing Android 13+ restrictions.

item.title: Threat Actor Bribes Overseas Support Agents to Steal Coinbase Customer Data
item.description: Coinbase disclosed a major security breach that exposed sensitive personal data of 69,461 users due to an advanced insider threat operation. Insiders in India were bribed by cybercriminals to exfiltrate confidential customer data from internal support tools. The breach was not a typical crypto hack exploiting blockchain vulnerabilities but rather a social engineering attack using stolen data for impersonation schemes.

item.title: Threat Actors Abuse ‘Prove You Are Human’ System to Distribute Malware
item.description: Threat actors are exploiting "Prove You Are Human" verification systems by spoofing legitimate platforms like Gitcodes and DocuSign to distribute malicious software, including the NetSupport Remote Access Trojan (RAT), which installs malware on Windows systems. The attack involves multi-stage execution of scripts, clipboard poisoning, and command-and-control server communication.

item.title: Microsoft Defender for Endpoint Prevents Cyberattack,Secures 180,000 Devices
item.description: This article does not discuss a specific vulnerability. Instead, it highlights the importance of endpoint detection and response (EDR) in today's cybersecurity landscape, particularly with the rise of ransomware attacks. It introduces Microsoft Defender for Endpoint as a solution that leverages AI, machine learning, and global threat intelligence to deliver comprehensive protection across various devices.

item.title: Hackers Exploit Ruby Gems to Steal Telegram Tokens and Messages
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Ruby Gems; CVE(s): None; Summary: Malicious actors embedded backdoors in seemingly legitimate Ruby Gems, enabling them to steal sensitive Telegram tokens and private messages from unsuspecting developers and users. The attack begins with hackers uploading tainted Ruby Gems to the official repository, which silently execute code that scans the host system for Telegram API tokens and exfiltrates them to a remote command-and-control (C2) server.

item.title: Custom Active Directory Extensions Create Stealthy Backdoors for Corporate Attacks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Active Directory (AD); CVE(s): None; Summary: The article discusses a technique used by attackers to create custom Client-Side Extensions (CSEs) for Group Policy Objects (GPOs), allowing them to execute code with SYSTEM privileges during GPO refreshes. This can be done by creating a DLL that exports the ProcessGroupPolicy function and registering it using regsvr32.

item.title: ThreatBook Selected In The First-ever Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ For Network Detection And Response (NDR)
item.description: Vulnerable Product: None; Summary: This article does not discuss a vulnerability. Instead, it is about ThreatBook's Network Detection and Response (NDR) technology and its inclusion in Gartner's first Magic Quadrant for NDR. The article highlights the capabilities of ThreatBook TDP, including its ability to detect zero-day attacks, identify attack surfaces, and provide closed-loop response.

item.title: DollyWay World Domination Attack Compromises 20,000+ Sites
item.description: Vulnerable Product: WordPress; CVE(s): None; Summary: A sophisticated malware campaign, dubbed "DollyWay World Domination", has compromised over 20,000 WordPress websites worldwide by exploiting vulnerabilities in plugins and themes. The malware injects JavaScript and PHP code to evade detection, disables security plugins, and redirects users to malicious destinations for affiliate monetization purposes.

item.title: HPE Issues Security Patch for StoreOnce Bug Allowing Remote Authentication Bypass
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) StoreOnce; CVE(s): CVE-2025-37093, CVE-2025-37089, CVE-2025-37090, CVE-2025-37091, CVE-2025-37092, CVE-2025-37094, CVE-2025-37095, CVE-2025-37096; Summary: The StoreOnce data backup and deduplication solution has eight vulnerabilities that could lead to remote code execution, information disclosure, server-side request forgery, authentication bypass, arbitrary file deletion, and directory traversal. The most severe flaw is an authentication bypass bug (CVE-2025-37093) rated 9.8 on the CVSS scoring system, which could be chained with other flaws for more severe impacts.

item.title: ZDI-25-321: GIMP ICO File Parsing Integer Overflow Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: GIMP; CVE(s): CVE-2025-5473; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of GIMP, requiring user interaction. The flaw exists in the parsing of ICO files due to a lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, leading to an integer overflow before writing to memory.

item.title: ZDI-25-322: 2BrightSparks SyncBackFree Link Following Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: 2BrightSparks SyncBackFree; CVE(s): CVE-2025-5474; Summary: This vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges on affected installations of 2BrightSparks SyncBackFree by exploiting a local privilege escalation flaw in the Mirror functionality, requiring user interaction and low-privileged code execution.

item.title: ZDI-25-323: Action1 Uncontrolled Search Path Element Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Action1; CVE(s): CVE-2025-5480; Summary: This vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges on affected installations of Action1 by exploiting an unsecured location where OpenSSL configuration files are loaded. The attacker must first obtain the ability to execute low-privileged code on the target system, and can then leverage this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code in the context of SYSTEM.

item.title: ZDI-25-324: Sante DICOM Viewer Pro DCM File Parsing Out-Of-Bounds Write Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Sante, DICOM Viewer Pro; CVE(s): CVE-2025-5481; Summary: The vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Sante DICOM Viewer Pro by exploiting a lack of proper validation of user-supplied data in the parsing of DCM files. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability, as the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file.

item.title: OpenAI is hopeful GPT-5 will compete a little more
item.description: OpenAI is developing a new AI model, GPT-5, which will be more competitive with existing models. The company is also working on upgrading its GPTs and Operator (AI Agent) products, but no specific timelines have been provided.

item.title: ChatGPT rolls out Memory upgrade for free users
item.description: The article discusses an update to ChatGPT's memory feature, which will allow free accounts to remember and reference past conversations. However, there are limitations to this feature for free users, who will only have access to short-term continuity across conversations.

item.title: Hewlett Packard Enterprise warns of critical StoreOnce auth bypass
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) StoreOnce; CVE(s): CVE-2025-37089, CVE-2025-37090, CVE-2025-37091, CVE-2025-37092, CVE-2025-37093, CVE-2025-37094, CVE-2025-37095, CVE-2025-37096; Summary: The HPE StoreOnce software has eight vulnerabilities, including a critical authentication bypass vulnerability (CVE-2025-37093) with a CVSS v3.1 score of 9.8, which can be exploited to gain unauthorized access to the system. Other flaws include remote code execution bugs, directory traversal problems, and server-side request forgery issues, all impacting versions of StoreOnce software before v4.3.11, which is now the recommended upgrade version.

item.title: Coinbase breach tied to bribed TaskUs support agents in India
item.description: A recent data breach at Coinbase was linked to India-based customer support representatives from outsourcing firm TaskUs, who were bribed by threat actors to steal sensitive user data. The incident was discovered in January 2025 and impacted nearly 70,000 customers, with estimated losses of up to $400 million.

item.title: Microsoft adds quick machine recovery to Windows 11 settings
item.description: Microsoft is testing a dedicated page in Windows Settings for quick machine recovery, which will provide users with additional configuration options. This new feature aims to streamline access to important features that help keep devices running smoothly and fix Windows boot issues using targeted fixes without requiring physical access. The feature is initially available to Insiders in the Beta Channel and Dev Channel.

item.title: Malicious RubyGems pose as Fastlane to steal Telegram API data
item.description: Vulnerable Product: RubyGems; CVE(s): None; Summary: Two malicious RubyGems packages posing as Fastlane CI/CD plugins redirect Telegram API requests to attacker-controlled servers, intercepting and stealing sensitive data including chat IDs, message content, attached files, proxy credentials, and bot tokens.

item.title: New Linux PumaBot Targets IoT Devices with SSH Credential Brute-Force Attack
item.description: PumaBot is a Go-based Linux botnet that exploits embedded IoT devices using targeted brute-force attacks on SSH credentials. It deploys its malicious binary, establishes persistence, and executes remote commands, primarily focusing on cryptocurrency mining. The botnet's infection chain involves evasion techniques, including fingerprinting logic to sidestep honeypots and restricted environments.

item.title: Russian Hacker Black Owl Targets Critical Industries to Steal Financial Data
item.description: A pro-Ukrainian hacktivist group called BO Team (also known as Black Owl) has been identified as a significant threat to Russian organizations in 2025. The group's tactics include spear phishing, backdoor installation, data destruction, encryption, and credential theft, with the goal of causing maximum infrastructural damage while pursuing financial extortion.

item.title: Fake DocuSign, Gitcode Sites Spread NetSupport RAT via Multi-Stage PowerShell Attack
item.description: A new campaign uses deceptive websites to trick users into executing malicious PowerShell scripts, which download and install the NetSupport RAT malware on victim machines. The script works by using clipboard poisoning to copy a command to the user's clipboard, which is then executed by pasting it into the Windows Run dialog.

item.title: Top Russian Dark Web Market Tools Drive Surge in Credential Theft Attacks
item.description: Russian Market, a notorious automated vending platform, has solidified its position as the leading hub for stolen credentials, fueling a dramatic rise in credential theft attacks worldwide. The platform offers an inventory of over 5 million logs containing tens to hundreds of compromised credentials, providing cybercriminals with affordable and efficient means to breach accounts.

item.title: Researchers Reveal Container-Based Attacks Through Host-Based Log Analysis
item.description: Vulnerable Product: N/A; CVE(s): None; Summary: Containers are not as isolated as believed due to reliance on shared host kernel. Host-based log analysis is critical in uncovering sophisticated attacks and identifying malicious processes, including those using BusyBox-based containers like Alpine. This highlights a gap in container security awareness and emphasizes the need for proper monitoring and response capabilities.

item.title: Mozilla launches new system to detect Firefox crypto drainer add-ons
item.description: Mozilla has developed a new security feature for its add-on portal to block malicious extensions that drain cryptocurrency wallets. The feature creates risk profiles for each submitted wallet extension and triggers automated risk alerts if a pre-defined threshold is exceeded, prompting human reviewers to remove malicious extensions from the store.

item.title: State-Sponsored Groups Intensify Attacks on Manufacturing Sector and OT Systems
item.description: A recent report by Forescout Technologies reveals a significant surge in active threat actors targeting the manufacturing sector, with 71% growth compared to the previous year. The report highlights the involvement of state-sponsored groups, cybercriminals, and hacktivist groups, as well as the exploitation of vulnerabilities in VPNs, remote access solutions, and file transfer applications, and the use of advanced evasion strategies such as living-off-the-land techniques and endpoint detection response (EDR) bypass tools.

item.title: Android Security Update Addresses High-Severity Privilege Escalation Flaws
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Multiple Android devices; CVE(s): None listed; Summary: A series of high-severity vulnerabilities affecting a wide range of Android devices were disclosed in the June 2025 Android Security Bulletin. The most critical vulnerability is an escalation of privilege flaw in the System component, which could allow an attacker to gain elevated access with minimal user interaction and no additional execution privileges required.

item.title: Scattered Spider: Three things the news doesn’t tell you
item.description: Scattered Spider is a group of cybercriminals that has been linked to several high-profile attacks on UK retailers and other organizations. They use a range of identity-based tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs) to bypass multi-factor authentication (MFA) and achieve account takeover. The group's methods include help desk scams, SIM swapping, smishing, basic credential phishing, and Attacker-in-the-Middle (AiTM) phishing toolkits. They have been known to target accounts with elevated permissions and use their initial intrusions as a foothold for further attacks.

item.title: Aembit Extends Workload IAM to Microsoft Ecosystem, Securing Hybrid Access for Non-Human Identities
item.description: Aembit, a workload identity and access management (IAM) company, has expanded its platform to support Microsoft environments, enabling secure policy-based access for software workloads and agentic AI running on Windows Server, Active Directory, Microsoft Entra ID, and Azure. The launch aims to provide a unified approach to secure workload access management across the Microsoft ecosystem and beyond, reducing operational complexity while improving visibility, automation, and risk posture.

item.title: CISA warns of ConnectWise ScreenConnect bug exploited in attacks
item.description:
Vulnerable Product: ConnectWise ScreenConnect; CVE(s): CVE-2025-3935; Summary: A recently patched vulnerability in ScreenConnect could allow remote code execution on the server through ViewState code injection attacks. The vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2025-3935, was found to be actively exploited by hackers.
FYSA: CISA is warning federal agencies of four other security problems affecting ASUS routers and Craft CMS that are also actively exploited. The flaws include authentication bypass in ASUS GT-AC2900 and Lyra Mini devices (CVE-2021-32030), OS injection in ASUS RT-AX55 devices (CVE-2023-39780), code injection in Craft CMS (CVE-2024-56145), and an unauthenticated client could introduce PHP code to known file locations on the Craft CMS server (CVE-2025-35939).

item.title: North Face Fashion Brand Alerts Customers to Credential Stuffing Attack
item.description: This article is about a credential stuffing attack that occurred on The North Face's website. Attackers used stolen authentication credentials to gain unauthorized access to user accounts, exposing personal information such as email addresses, names, and purchase histories.

item.title: Victoria’s Secret delays earnings release after security incident
item.description: The article reports on a security incident at Victoria's Secret, where corporate systems were taken down as a precautionary measure. While the nature of the incident is not disclosed, it appears to be potentially related to ransomware and restoration efforts are ongoing.

item.title: Apple iOS Activation Flaw Enables Injection of Unauthenticated XML Payloads
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Apple iOS Activation Backend; CVE(s): None; Summary: A severe vulnerability in Apple's iOS activation infrastructure allows attackers to inject unauthenticated XML .plist payloads without verification or signature validation. This enables arbitrary provisioning changes and persistent configuration manipulation, exposing devices to tampering before they are fully activated.

item.title: Critical 10-Year-Old Roundcube Webmail Bug Allows Authenticated Users Run Malicious Code
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Roundcube Webmail; CVE(s): CVE-2025-49113; Summary: The vulnerability is a post-authenticated remote code execution via PHP object deserialization, affecting all versions of Roundcube before and including 1.6.10. It has a CVSS score of 9.9 out of 10.0 and can be exploited to take over susceptible systems and execute arbitrary code.

item.title: CISA Alerts on ConnectWise ScreenConnect Authentication Vulnerability Actively Exploited
item.description: Vulnerable Product: ConnectWise ScreenConnect; CVE(s): CVE-2025-3935; Summary: The vulnerability affects all ScreenConnect versions up to and including 25.2.3, allowing ViewState code injection attacks that could result in remote code execution (RCE) if machine keys are compromised.

item.title: New Safari XSS Vulnerability Exploits JavaScript Error Handling to Run Arbitrary Code
item.description: Vulnerable Product: None; CVE(s): "None"; Summary: The article discusses a lesser-known technique to exploit cross-site scripting (XSS) by leveraging JavaScript TypeError messages in Safari. This technique involves forcing a TypeError and injecting a payload into the error message, which can be executed using the eval function or other methods.

item.title: New Report: Governments Struggle to Regain Backdoor Access to Secure Communications
item.description: Governments worldwide are struggling with strong encryption in messaging apps, social media platforms, and VPNs, but a "golden key" or backdoor mechanism allowing authorized access remains mathematically and practically infeasible without introducing vulnerabilities exploitable by malicious actors. Despite decades of efforts, governments face an ever-widening gap between their surveillance ambitions and technological realities.

item.title: Meta and Yandex are de-anonymizing Android users’ web browsing identifiers
item.description: The article discusses a feature in Google's Android operating system that allows Meta (formerly Facebook) to track user activities on Android devices through the Meta Pixel. This is done by creating a local port access on port 12387, which can be accessed without explicit permission from the device owner.

item.title: Meta and Yandex are de-anonymizing Android users’ web browsing identifiers
item.description: This article discusses unexplained local port access issues with Meta Pixel (formerly Facebook Pixel) on Android devices. It highlights concerns around privacy violations and tracking of user activities by Meta and other companies, but does not identify a specific vulnerability or exploitation details.

item.title: CISA Adds Three Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Qualcomm Multiple Chipsets; CVE(s): CVE-2025-21479, CVE-2025-21480, CVE-2025-27038; Summary: The three vulnerabilities added to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog are frequent attack vectors for malicious cyber actors and pose significant risks to the federal enterprise. These vulnerabilities affect Qualcomm multiple chipsets and can lead to incorrect authorization or use-after-free issues if not remediated.

item.title: Schneider Electric EcoStruxure Power Build Rapsody
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Schneider Electric EcoStruxure Power Build Rapsody; CVE(s): CVE-2025-3916; Summary: A stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability exists in Schneider Electric's EcoStruxure Power Build Rapsody, allowing local attackers to execute arbitrary code by opening a malicious project file (SSD file) provided by the attacker. Successful exploitation could lead to arbitrary code execution on the affected device.

item.title: CISA Releases Three Industrial Control Systems Advisories
item.description: CISA releases three Industrial Control Systems (ICS) advisories on June 3, 2025, providing information about current security issues, vulnerabilities, and exploits surrounding ICS. The advisories relate to Schneider Electric Wiser Home Automation, Schneider Electric EcoStruxure Power Build Rapsody, and Mitsubishi Electric MELSEC iQ-F Series products.

item.title: Schneider Electric Wiser Home Automation
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Schneider Electric Wiser AvatarOn 6K Freelocate and Wiser Cuadro H 5P Socket; CVE(s): CVE-2023-4041; Summary: A buffer copy without checking size of input ("Classic Buffer Overflow") vulnerability allows an attacker to inject code or bypass authentication, affecting all versions of Wiser AvatarOn 6K Freelocate and Wiser Cuadro H 5P Socket. Successful exploitation could lead to code injection or authentication bypass.

item.title: Mitsubishi Electric MELSEC iQ-F Series
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Mitsubishi Electric MELSEC iQ-F Series; CVE(s): CVE-2025-3755; Summary: The vulnerability allows a remote attacker to read confidential information, cause a denial-of-service condition, or stop operations by sending specially crafted packets. Exploitation can occur with low attack complexity and is exploitable remotely.

item.title: Hackers Abuse AI Tool Misconfigurations to Execute Malicious AI-Generated Payloads
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Open WebUI; CVE(s): None; Summary: A misconfigured instance of Open WebUI, a self-hosted AI interface, was exploited by an attacker to inject malicious Python scripts, deploy cryptominers, and execute infostealer malware. The vulnerability allowed attackers to access the system with administrative privileges and no authentication, highlighting the critical need for robust runtime security and multi-layer threat detection.

item.title: New Research Uncovers Strengths and Vulnerabilities in Cloud-Based LLM Guardrails
item.description: The article discusses the vulnerabilities inherent in cloud-based Large Language Model (LLM) guardrails, which are designed to mitigate risks such as data leakage and malicious exploitation. Researchers reveal that while these guardrails offer robust protection in certain scenarios, they can be bypassed by sophisticated attackers using techniques like encoded prompts or fragmented queries, and also highlight the importance of adaptive security frameworks to address emerging threats.

item.title: Scattered Spider: Understanding Help Desk Scams and How to Defend Your Organization
item.description: Scattered Spider threat group uses help desk scams as a reliable way to bypass MFA and achieve account takeover. They target accounts likely to have top-tier admin privileges, allowing them to launch further attacks such as stealing data or deploying ransomware. The group has been using this tactic since 2022 and has successfully attacked several high-profile targets, including UK retailers Marks & Spencer and Co-op.

item.title: Threat Actors Exploit DevOps Web Server Misconfigurations to Deploy Malware
item.description: Threat actors are exploiting misconfigurations in DevOps-managed web servers to deploy malicious payloads, including malware strains like AsyncRAT and Lyrix Ransomware. Phishing scams play a pivotal role in the initial compromise, tricking DevOps personnel into granting access or downloading malicious scripts that initiate the infection chain. The attacks often bypass security tools through clever obfuscation techniques, highlighting the need for robust security practices and proactive defense mechanisms.

item.title: Splunk Universal Forwarder for Windows Flaw Grants Non-Admin Users Full Content Access
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Splunk Universal Forwarder for Windows; CVE(s): CVE-2025-20298; Summary: The Splunk Universal Forwarder for Windows has a high-severity vulnerability (CVE-2025-20298) that allows non-administrator users to access and modify files in the installation directory, leading to local privilege escalation or compromising sensitive log data.

item.title: Google patches new Chrome zero-day bug exploited in attacks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Google Chrome; CVE(s): CVE-2025-5419; Summary: A high-severity out-of-bounds read and write weakness exists in Chrome's V8 JavaScript engine, which is being exploited in the wild. The vulnerability was mitigated by a configuration change and has since been fixed with the release of version 137.0.7151.68/.69 for Windows/Mac and Linux.

item.title: Splunk Enterprise XSS Flaw Enables Attackers to Execute Unauthorized JavaScript
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Splunk; CVE(s): CVE-2025-20297; Summary: The vulnerable product is Splunk Enterprise and Cloud Platform; a reflected Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the dashboard PDF generation component, allowing low-privileged users to execute unauthorized JavaScript without user interaction.

item.title: Beware: Fake Booking.com Sites Spread AsyncRAT Malware to Infect Devices
item.description: Cybercriminals are redirecting links to counterfeit Booking.com websites, leading users to fake sites that compromise devices with malware. The scam uses a dynamic strategy and fake CAPTCHA prompts, ultimately downloading malicious files like the Backdoor.AsyncRAT Remote Access Trojan.

item.title: Lost in Resolution: Azure OpenAI's DNS Resolution Issue
